data.text:
@Neurofourier And vaccines actually available for <5. 

Honestly it’s hard not to take this personally as a parent of 2 kiddos <5.
@Neurofourier And especially on ECE. None of those kids can even be vaccinated.

@Neurofourier Now,it feels like families with kids below 5 should be infected first to create herd immunity. Are we in a horror movie? We need covid vaccines for below 5 NOW. Please help and pressure FDA/CDC to action as you did for the 5-11 cohort.@RepKatiePorter @RepRoKhanna #ImmunizeU5

@Neurofourier I’m vaccinated x4, but immunocompromised 
Day 717 of self isolation 
Feel pushed into dusty corner by CDC
Fear this causes us to lose accommodations such as countless 
delivery, drop off at garage, ability to ask service people to 
wear masks, etc
💔

To add as well, I still believe we need to address the very noticeable gap within the school system and vaccinations. Until that is addressed, I wished language was stronger on consistent/comprehensive masking across all school systems until we get more of the <12 vaxxed.
@Neurofourier Interesting, although it would be even better to see the actual scientific discussion leading to (or ignored by) the decision, similar to last year's PowerPoint leak.

Is it perfect? Not necessarily, but it hits on a core component of what I had discussed a few days ago on having data-driven baseline to gauge easing of NPI’s.  We also need to be clear that these don’t mean that it’s permanent either, and must remain flexible. https://t.co/Tf8FJP9OJq

High level framework. I actually do think this is a good start but this will take a lot of work from local, state, and federal level to ensure we’re tracking across the population. https://t.co/p2sMxWdcG0

Guidance is up. I’ll have my take on it in a few 

https://t.co/TQD2YpwPnO
@Neurofourier I’m hoping the guidance recognizes that 100% of children under five are unvaccinated, and cannot mask or are imperfect maskers. Nothing to do but wait and see. Thank you for sharing.
